block.p: Anne Midgette zeroed in on a significant problem for the future of classical music: how to maintain interest in it in our visually oriented society [''In a World Made of Sound, a Medium in Search of a Role,'' Aug. 17].

Anne Midgette zeroed in on a significant problem for the future of classical music: how to maintain interest in it in our visually oriented society [''In a World Made of Sound, a Medium in Search of a Role,'' Aug. 17].

The answer is obvious. We have plenty of examples on MTV of mediocre visual art placed in the service of mediocre music. Why not great art married to great music? What about classical music videos? I'm not talking about just opera or concert footage, although that could be part of it. I'm talking about compelling images created by some of our best visual artists, illustrating our greatest classics. It would be a new minor art form, and offer access to great music for young listeners.
